forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly clear, with a low around 53. West southwest wind 10 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 20 mph.

forecast.name: Juneteenth
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 62, with temperatures falling to around 60 in the afternoon. West wind 9 to 24 mph, with gusts as high as 31 mph.

weather_report:
Tonight, Downtown San Francisco basks under a mostly clear sky, offering a serene ambiance as the low temperatures hover around the refreshing 53 degrees. A gentle west-southwest breeze whispers through the city, occasionally catching the last glints of sunlight before they fade into dusk. As the evening darkens, the brisk winds, gusting up to 20 mph, bring a hint of crispness that invigorates the senses.

Looking forward to Juneteenth, sunny tranquility will characterize the day, with highs nearing 62 degrees. The temperatures will gracefully descend into the afternoon, ushering in a comfortable chill perfect for a light layering. The winds will strengthen, swirling up to 24 mph and occasionally gusting higher, making it an excellent day for those who embrace the outdoors. An ideal wardrobe choice would include a light jacket or sweater, accompanied by comfortable shoes for exploring the neighborhood's open spaces. With the clear skies and buoyant air, it’s a fine time to engage in leisurely walks, perhaps meandering through local parks or bustling street fairs. As the sun graces the city, the backdrop of the Golden Gate and the sprawling hills becomes a visual poetry, one that whispers secrets of summer yet to come.
